channel.title: Grid based on Climate Tools
channel.description: Recent content in Grid based on Climate Tools

item.title: Coastal Change Hazards Portal
item.description: Developed By: USGS Summary: The USGS Coastal Change Hazards Portal is an easy to use tool that synthesizes geospatial information about extreme storms, shorelines change, and sea level rise and makes it available for viewing and download.

item.title: Delaware Air Quality Forecast
item.description: Developed By: DDNREC Summary: The Delaware Air Quality Forecast is a user-friendly forecast that provides daily air quality forecasts for the state of Delaware.

item.title: Earth::Global wind patterns
item.description: Developed By: Cameron Beccario Summary: This real-time visualization of global environmental conditions is a great illustration of atmospheric and oceanic circulation and Earth’s physical systems.

item.title: PINEMAP
item.description: Developed By: North Carolina State Climate Office, and USDA Summary: PINEMAP is a suite of 13 products focusing on loblolly pines in the Southeastern US across four categories: Environment, Establishment, Management, and Production.

item.title: AdaptVA: Interactive Map
item.description: Developed By: VIMS_CCRM Summary: This tool from AdaptVA uses an interactive map to display sea level rise projections and FEMA flood hazard zones, as well as social vulnerability, infrastructure, and natural capital in a single viewer.

item.title: AdaptVA: Sea Level Rise Projection Viewer
item.description: Developed By: VIMS_CCRM Summary: The AdaptVA Sea Level Rise Projection Viewer uses an interactive map to display sea level rise projections for coastal Virginia.

item.title: Better Assessment Science Integrating Point and Non-point Sources (BASIN)
item.description: Developed By: EPA Summary: Better Assessment Science Integrating Point and Nonpoint Sources (BASINS) is a multipurpose environmental analysis system designed to help regional, state, and local agencies perform watershed- and water quality-based studies.

item.title: Climate Engine
item.description: Developed By: Desert Research Institute, University of Idaho, and Google

item.title: Creating Resilient Water Utilities: Storm Surge Inundation Map
item.description: Developed By: EPA Summary: Part of the Creating Resilient Water Utilities (CRWU), the Storm Surge Inundation tool is a map interface depicting extreme weather conditions.

item.title: Eastern Virginia Coastal Resilience (ESVA Coastal Resilience)
item.description: Developed By: NOAA, and TNC Summary: The Virginia Eastern Shore Coastal Resilience tool is an interactive mapping tool that allows users to visualize potential social, economic, and environmental impacts of sea level rise and storm surge and identify areas for nature-based solutions to enhance resilience and reduce risks where possible.

item.title: FEMA's National Flood Hazard Layer (NFHL) Viewer
item.description: Developed By: FEMA Summary: The National Flood Hazard Layer (NFHL) is an interactive mapping tool that allows users to view flood hazard maps and download Flood Insurance Rate Maps (FIRMS) from the Federal Emergency Management Agency (FEMA).

item.title: FloodFactor
item.description: Developed By: First Street Foundation Summary: FloodFactor is a flood risk mapping tool that shows the extent of potential inundation from tidal flooding and hurricane storm surge on the East and Gulf coasts of the U.

item.title: Hampton Roads Geospatial Exchange Online: Hampton Roads Sea Level Rise Planning Scenarios (Raster)
item.description: Developed By: HRPDC, HRSD, and HRTPO Summary: Part of Hampton Roads Geospatial Exchange Online, the Hampton Roads Sea Level Rise Planning Scenarios uses an interactive map to display sea level rise projections for Hampton Roads.

item.title: Know Your Zone
item.description: Developed By: VDEM Summary: The Know Your Zone tool is an interactive mapping tool that allows residents of coastal Virginia to determine their evacuation zone for hurricanes and severe storms.

item.title: MARISA Climate Data Portal: Climate Data for the Mid-Atlantic Region
item.description: Developed By: NOAA, and MARISA Summary: Climate Data for the Mid-Atlantic Region contains a list and overview of climate data products in the region.

item.title: MARISA Climate Data Portal: Interactive Map for the MARISA Region
item.description: Developed By: NOAA, and MARISA Summary: The Interactive Map for the MARISA region is an interactive web map that enables users to view real time climate data for the MARISA region.

item.title: MARISA Climate Impacts Summary and Outlook Reports
item.description: Developed By: MARISA Summary: The MARISA Climate Impacts Summary and Outlook Reports are a quarterly series summarizing seasonal weather and climate trends and forecasts for the Chesapeake Bay Watershed.

item.title: Maryland Coastal Atlas
item.description: Developed By: MDNR Summary: The Maryland Coastal Atlas is a mapping tool that allows users query, map, and analyze spatial data to better understand Maryland’s coastal and marine resources.

item.title: Operational Forecast System: Chesapeake Bay Operational Forecast System (CBOFS)
item.description: Developed By: NOAA Summary: The Chesapeake Bay Operational Forecast System (CBOFS) tool is a data viewer that provides real time forecasts of oceanographic conditions in the Chesapeake Bay.

item.title: Operational Forecast System: Delaware Bay Operational Forecast System (DBOFS)
item.description: Developed By: NOAA, and Rutgers University_Regional Ocean Modeling System Summary: The Delaware Bay Operational Forecast System (DBOFS) tool is a data viewer that provides real time forecasts of oceanographic conditions in the Delaware Bay.

item.title: Potomac Inundation Maps
item.description: Developed By: DC Silver Jackets, NOAA_NWS, USACE, USGS, City of Alexandria, and DCDOEE

item.title: Riparian Restoration Decision Support Tool
item.description: Developed By: Appalachian Landscape Conservation Cooperative, USFS, and University of Massachusetts

item.title: Shoreline Assessment Mapper
item.description: Developed By: VIMS_CCRM Summary: The Shoreline Assessment Mapper is an interactive map that displays a variety of shoreline data for the coastal zone of Virginia.

item.title: Surging Seas Risk Zone Map (SSRZM)
item.description: Developed By: Climate Central Summary: The Surging Seas Risk Zone Map (SSRZM) displays coastal areas predicted to experience the effects of sea level rise (SLR) within the U.

item.title: USDA Plant Hardiness Zone Map
item.description: Developed By: USDA Summary: The United States Department of Agriculture (USDA) Plant hardiness Zone Map provides static and interactive maps to determine which plants are most likely to thrive at a location throughout the United States.

item.title: USGS Geo Data Portal (GDP)
item.description: Developed By: USGS Summary: The USGS Geo Data Portal (GDP) is designed for advanced users looking to access meteorological, climate, and urban growth data at national and regional scales.

item.title: Virginia Flood Risk Information System (VFRIS)
item.description: Developed By: VIMS, CCRM, and VDCR Summary: The Virginia Flood Risk Information System uses an interactive map to display FEMA flood risk zones in Virginia.

item.title: Virginia Wetland Condition Assessment Tool (WetCAT)
item.description: Developed By: CCRM, and VDEQ Summary: The Virginia Wetland Condition Assessment Tool (WetCAT) is an interactive map that assesses wetland capacity to perform ecosystem services and provides the tools to conduct analyses useful for wetland restoration efforts.
